did.unittitle: Company E, 12th Regiment Michigan Infantry Documents 1865
did.abstract: Three documents from Company E, 12th Regiment Michigan Infantry, written in the fourth quarter (November-December) of 1965. Collection includes a Statement of Charges on Muster and Pay Rolls; a Quarterly Return of Ordinance and Ordnance Stores Received, Issued, and Remaining on Hand; an Abstract of Expenditures; and an Invoice of Stores Turned Over.

bioghist.head: Historical Information
bioghist.p: The 12th Regiment Michigan Infantry was originally comprised of 2,357 volunteers organized at Niles, Dowagiac, and Buchanan, Michigan from December 9, 1861 to March 5, 1862. The regiment's term of serviced lasted until March 6, 1866, and it engaged Confederate troops at Pittsburg Landing, TN; Middleburg, TN; Little Rock, AR; Iuka, MS; Mechanicsville, MS; Clarendon, AR; Metamora, TN; Vicksburg, MS, and Gregory's Landing, AR. By the end of the Civil War, the total number of casualties was 316, the vast majority of those occurring from disease.

Harvey, Don, and Alice Harvey. "12th Regiment Michigan Volunteer Infantry." Michigan in the Civil War. National Military Cemetery Webring. Web. 19 Mar. 2010. http://www.michiganinthewar.org/infantry/12thinf.htm.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: This collection consists of four documents pertaining to Company E, 12th Regiment Michigan Infantry, all signed by Captain W. S. Bostwick in November of 1865. The documents are a Statement of Charges on Muster and Pay Rolls; a Quarterly Return of Ordinance and Ordnance Stores Received, Issued, and Remaining on Hand; an Abstract of Expenditures; and an Invoice of Stores Turned Over.
